name: Client
documentation:
Defines the low-level client contract used by {@link FluxzeroBuilder} to construct a {@link io.fluxzero.sdk.Fluxzero} instance.

Application developers must provide an implementation of this interface to the {@link FluxzeroBuilder#build(Client)} method. This allows for flexible configuration, enabling either an in-memory setup (useful for testing and local development) or a connected (WebSocket-based) client that integrates with the Fluxzero Runtime.

Client Implementations

Common implementations include:
  • {@link LocalClient} — for local, standalone use
  • {@link WebSocketClient} — connects to the Fluxzero Runtime using WebSockets

Responsibilities

A {@code Client} implementation is responsible for:
  • Providing access to gateway and tracking subsystems via {@link GatewayClient} and {@link TrackingClient}
  • Managing subsystems for event storage, scheduling, key-value access, and search
  • Handling client shutdown via {@link #shutDown()} and shutdown hooks
  • Optionally monitoring dispatches via {@link #monitorDispatch(ClientDispatchMonitor, MessageType...)}

Usage

{@code
 Client client = LocalClient.newInstance();
 Fluxzero fluxzero = FluxzeroBuilder.newInstance().build(client);
 }

methods.name: applicationId
methods.documentation: Returns the application ID under which this client instance is registered.

methods.name: beforeShutdown
getEventStoreClient
methods.documentation: Returns the {@link EventStoreClient} associated with this client for querying event logs.

methods.name: getGatewayClient
getGatewayClient
getKeyValueClient
methods.documentation:
Returns the {@link KeyValueClient} for key-value store interactions.

This is mostly deprecated and maintained for backward compatibility.

methods.name: getSchedulingClient
methods.documentation: Returns the {@link SchedulingClient} used to interact with the Fluxzero scheduling subsystem.

methods.name: getSearchClient
methods.documentation: Returns the {@link SearchClient} that provides access to document and search APIs.

methods.name: getTrackingClient
getTrackingClient
id
methods.documentation: Returns the unique identifier of this client instance. This id may be randomly generated.

methods.name: monitorDispatch
name
methods.documentation: Returns the name of this client as defined in its configuration.

methods.name: namespace
methods.documentation: Returns the namespace associated with this client instance.

methods.name: shutDown
methods.documentation:
Shuts down this client instance, releasing any underlying resources.

This includes closing websocket sessions, stopping tracking, and executing registered shutdown hooks.

methods.name: unwrap
